PETIi OLEUM COMMITTEE.(Note by Sir maurice Hankey)By a decision of the Cabinet the Petroleum Executivewill, as from November 20th, come under the direction ofLieut.Colonel Sir Hamer Greenwood, Bt., K.0. t M.P. but will be constituted as a soparate Department and independent of theDepartment of Overseas Trade.In addition to continuing its functions as an advisoryand consultative Department on petroleum questions, the petroleum executive will, by Cabinet direction, be consulted by the variousbuying Departments as to petroleum purchases. Arrangements willbe made to maintain o close liaison with the interested Depart-raents and Sir Hamar Greenwood hopes that the latter will not fail to make full use of the Petroleum Executive and to keep itinformed of any developments which may occur in matters affectingpetroleum policy.(signed) M.P.A.HenkeySecretary.2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W.1.24th November, 1919,
